error.signature: error: subprocess-exited-with-error: python setup.py egg_info did not run successfully

verdict.summary: Legacy setup.py based install failed. Package may need C compiler, headers, or pyproject.toml migration.

dead_ends.why_fails: May fix some cases but can cause dependency conflicts in build env
If a wheel exists, pip would already use it â€” it's building because there's no wheel

workarounds.action: Install build dependencies: apt install python3-dev build-essential (for C extensions)
workarounds.how:
sudo apt install python3-dev build-essential  # Debian/Ubuntu
brew install python  # macOS

workarounds.action: Check if a newer version has a pre-built wheel: pip install --prefer-binary <pkg>
Install package-specific system deps (e.g., libpq-dev for psycopg2, libxml2-dev for lxml)
workarounds.how: e.g., libpq-dev for psycopg2, libxml2-dev for lxml

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'error' indicates a subprocess command failure, while 'ERROR' indicates a package hash verification failure.
'error' indicates a subprocess command failure, while 'WARNING' indicates installation of a yanked (recalled) package version.
